comment.author: 24771397@N00
comment._content: What's amazing is that the street lamp is really the only thing that indicates this photo was not taken today, almost a century later.

comment.author: 47873717@N00
comment._content: 17th Street and Irving place. Still standing. You can see it in street view on Google Maps: maps.google.com/maps?f=q&hl=en&geocode=&time=...

comment.author: 68468874@N00
comment._content: Some renovation done to the bldg. about five yrs. ago changed the front window.

comment.author: 21053346@N00
comment._content: It does appear there have been some changes. It seems that the chimney  might be gone now, though I guess that might be a function of the angle from which the newer photo was shot.

comment.author: 23386487@N08
comment._content: Ive grown up in NYC and THIS house has always been my "dream home" i love the ivy, so amazing to stumble upon it like this!

comment.author: 70419861@N00
comment._content: Hi, I am administrator for a non-profit photoblog focusing entirely on walls with climbing plants. This picture would work fine on the site. If you like to share this photo without payment (but your name/nickname can be credited next to the pic if you wish so) send it to : wallweaver@hotmail.com (or let me know if this photograph can be downloaded from here with your permission). Please also provide information of location (example London, Great Britain) best regards, Satuine, Sweden The site: www.wall-weaver.blogspot.com
